**BUREAU CODE:  6706661**

**​OR**

**City Offices will be closed February 16, 2026, in observance of President's Day.**

**IMPORTANT**

If your appearance or court date falls on a Friday, Saturday, Sunday, City Holiday, or day that offices are closed due to inclement weather, your appearance or court date will automatically default to the next regular business day.

**KNOW YOUR RIGHTS**

* You must always enter a plea before a judgement can be rendered.
* You have the right to hire an attorney.  The Cisco Municipal Court is not required to provide a court appointed attorney.
* You have the right to plead "not guilty" and appear at a trial by judge or a trial by jury with a required $200.00 Appearance Bond filed with the court.
* You have the right to enter a plea of "no contest" or "guilty".  Upon conviction, a judgement with fine/costs will be rendered.
* You have the right to appeal a judgement of this court to the Eastland County Court by providing this court with an Appeal Bond for twice the amount of the judgement.
* If you are financially unable to pay a fine/costs, you have alternative options, including requesting a 30-day extension, requesting a payment plan, or, in certain circumstances, requesting community service.
* You may have a right to use jail credit to satisfy fines/costs owed if you were confined in jail or prison after the date of the alleged offense.
* You may be entitled to a waiver of fines due to indigence or insufficient resources to pay if discharging the fine through community service would impose an undue hardship.

###### **​****Credit card payments by phone: 1-866-549-1010**

[![](https://nebula.wsimg.com/8ae57ad8073130f442d9144a1b059e51?AccessKeyId=E76D055F4D43584A160C&disposition=0&alloworigin=1)](https://certifiedpayments.net/PaymentWizard_3.aspx)

Cisco Municipal Court is open between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., Monday through Thursday.**Fridays, in person, by appointment ONLY.** 

​**Phones will NOT be answered on Fridays.**

Juvenile Defendants (under the age of 17) must appear before the Court in person and with a parent.

Minors with alcohol offenses (under the age of 21) must appear in person before the Court.

**[Fine Schedule--List of Common Fines & Fees](https://nebula.wsimg.com/3025e47e0bd1f504f17871500f85be42?AccessKeyId=E76D055F4D43584A160C&disposition=0&alloworigin=1)**

​

​    **Accepted Methods of Payment**

* Money Order
* Cashier's Check
* Cash (in person, DO NOT send cash in the mail)
* Credit Card or Debit Card​

​​Personal checks are **NOT** accepted.

**Deferred Disposition and Driver Safety Course** - You MAY be able to have your citation dismissed upon completion of a [Driver Safety Course](https://nebula.wsimg.com/f769e5cc62826aaf79f371709f713e2e?AccessKeyId=E76D055F4D43584A160C&disposition=0&alloworigin=1) or [Deferred Disposition](https://nebula.wsimg.com/c85d4f9472e85a2c174294e7ee27d1fd?AccessKeyId=E76D055F4D43584A160C&disposition=0&alloworigin=1). Click to view conditions and requirements.

**Alternative options** –   If you are financially unable to pay, other options such as payment plans and/or  community service are available. You MUST contact the court for approval of alternative options  .If you are unable to pay and unable to complete alternative options, the Court will hear sworn testimony and evidence concerning your financial situation to help resolve this matter. In severe instances, the judge can reduce or dismiss fines and court costs upon hearing sworn testimony, depending on the severity of your financial status..

**Pro Se Defendants:**

**[Office of Court Administration Self Help Guidelines](http://www.txcourts.gov/programs-services/self-help/)**

[**Texas State Law Library**](https://www.sll.texas.gov/)

**STOP and READ**

**IF YOU HAVE NOT CONTACTED THE COURT TO DISCUSS YOUR CITATION, PLEASE DO** **NOT** **MAKE A CREDIT CARD PAYMENT.  YOU MUST CONTACT THE COURT TO ENSURE THAT YOU HAVE ALL THE INFORMATION NECESSARY, INCLUDING POTENTIAL DISMISSAL OPTIONS AND CITATION BALANCES.**

* ​**You must contact the Court for permission before paying Deferral, Defensive Driving, or making partial payments.**
* ​You will need the following before proceeding with your credit card payment​:​

​                  1. Amount that you need to pay

                  2. Citation number listed on your ticket or Docket/Cause number

* Agreeing to make a payment online constitutes a plea of 'no contest' to the violation.

* ​A 2.85% fee is charged by Certified Payments.
* ​Payment will not be processed until the next business day. If there is a warrant for your arrest, it will not be recalled until the day the payment is posted.
* Be sure to get the confirmation number when your payment has been accepted by Certified Payments. You will have the opportunity to print the receipt.

**Once you have read the above information**

click the link below for online credit card payments

You will be redirected to Certified Payments​​.

**> > >  From there click "CONTINUE" on the bottom right of the page.  < < <**
